wikipedia_data.title: Leonhard Euler
biography_paragraphs: Leonhard Euler (/ˈɔɪlər/ OY-lər;[b] 15 April 1707 – 18 September 1783) was a Swiss polymath who was active as a mathematician, physicist, astronomer, logician, geographer, and engineer. He founded the studies of graph theory and topology and made influential discoveries in many other branches of mathematics, such as analytic number theory, complex analysis, and infinitesimal calculus. He also introduced much of modern mathematical terminology and notation, including the notion of a mathematical function.[3] He is known for his work in mechanics, fluid dynamics, optics, astronomy, and music theory.[4] Euler has been called a "universal genius" who "was fully equipped with almost unlimited powers of imagination, intellectual gifts and extraordinary memory".[5] He spent most of his adult life in Saint Petersburg, Russia, and in Berlin, then the capital of Prussia.

timeline_events.description: Born in Basel, Swiss Confederacy on April 15, 1707
timeline_events.source_text: Leonhard Euler (15 April 1707 – 18 September 1783) was a Swiss polymath

timeline_events.description: Entered University of Basel at age 13, studying under Johann Bernoulli
timeline_events.source_text: Euler studied at the University of Basel under Johann Bernoulli

timeline_events.description: Published his first paper on reciprocal trajectories
timeline_events.source_text: Euler's first mathematical paper was on reciprocal trajectories

timeline_events.description: Traveled to St. Petersburg to join the Imperial Academy of Sciences
timeline_events.source_text: He spent most of his adult life in Saint Petersburg, Russia

timeline_events.description: Appointed as adjunct professor at St. Petersburg Academy of Sciences
timeline_events.source_text: Joined the Imperial Academy of Sciences in St. Petersburg

timeline_events.description: Promoted to professor of mathematics at St. Petersburg Academy
timeline_events.source_text: Became full professor of mathematics in St. Petersburg

timeline_events.description: Solved the famous Basel problem, finding the sum of reciprocals of squares
timeline_events.source_text: Euler has also been credited for solving the famous Basel problem

timeline_events.description: Published solution to Seven Bridges of Königsberg problem, founding graph theory
timeline_events.source_text: Euler is credited with being the first to develop graph theory (partly as a solution for the problem of the Seven Bridges of Königsberg)

timeline_events.description: Moved to Berlin at invitation of Frederick the Great of Prussia

location.raw_text: moved to Berlin, then the capital of Prussia

timeline_events.source_text: He spent most of his adult life in Saint Petersburg, Russia, and in Berlin, then the capital of Prussia

timeline_events.description: Appointed director of mathematics at Berlin Academy of Sciences
timeline_events.source_text: Became head of mathematics at Frederick's Academy in Berlin

timeline_events.description: Published Introductio in analysin infinitorum, revolutionary work in mathematical analysis
timeline_events.source_text: Introductio revolutionized mathematical analysis and notation

timeline_events.description: Returned to St. Petersburg after disputes with Frederick the Great
timeline_events.source_text: Euler returned to St. Petersburg after conflicts in Berlin

timeline_events.description: Died in St. Petersburg on September 18, 1783, at age 76
